page.title: 06RELIGION
page.content: INGLEBY GREENHOW CHURCH HOLDS TWO SERVICES EACH WEEK.IT HAS 200 MEMBERS AND A MOTHERS UNION AND A PARISH CHURCH COUNCIL FOR THE CHURCH REPRESENTATIVES.THE CHURCH HAS ENOUGH MONEY TO KEEP IT GOING.INGLEBY GREENHOW PEOPLE MEET JESUS AT CHURCH EVERY SUNDAY BY FAITH AND DURING EACH WEEK THEY TRY TO TREAT OTHER PEOPLE LIKE JESUS.WE HAVE A HOLY COMMUNION THE BISHOP CONFIRMS PEOPLE.PEOPLE ARE BAPTISED AND MARRIED IN CHURCH. SOME PEOPLE ARE BURIED IN THE CHURCHYARD.MOTHERS AND SMALL CHILDREN HAVE SPECIAL SERVICES OCCASIONALLY. WE STILL USE THE SILVER CHALICE AND PATEN WHICH WAS MADE IN 1571. THERE HAS BEEN A CHURCH IN INGLEBY GREENHOW SINCE SAXON TIMES AND THE RECORDS GO BACK TO 1120.
